Package org.cyclops.integrateddynamics.core.part.panel

Class PartTypePanelVariableDriven<P extends PartTypePanelVariableDriven<P,S>,S extends PartTypePanelVariableDriven.State<P,S>>

java.lang.Object
org.cyclops.integrateddynamics.api.part.PartTypeAdapter<P,S>
org.cyclops.integrateddynamics.core.part.PartTypeBase<P,S>
org.cyclops.integrateddynamics.core.part.panel.PartTypePanel<P,S>
org.cyclops.integrateddynamics.core.part.panel.PartTypePanelVariableDriven<P,S>
All Implemented Interfaces:
INetworkEventListener<IPartNetworkElement<P,S>>, IPartType<P,S>, IPartTypeActiveVariable<P,S>
Direct Known Subclasses:
PartTypePanelDisplay, PartTypePanelLightDynamic
public abstract class PartTypePanelVariableDriven<P extends PartTypePanelVariableDriven<P,S>,S extends PartTypePanelVariableDriven.State<P,S>> extends PartTypePanel<P,S> implements IPartTypeActiveVariable<P,S>
A panel part that is driven by a contained variable.

    • shouldTriggerBlockRenderUpdate

      public boolean shouldTriggerBlockRenderUpdate(@Nullable S oldPartState, @Nullable S newPartState)
      Description copied from interface: IPartType
      Check if the given state change should trigger a block render update. This is only called client-side. The new and old partstates are never both null, at most one will be null.
      Specified by:
      shouldTriggerBlockRenderUpdate in interface IPartType<P extends PartTypePanelVariableDriven<P,S>,S extends PartTypePanelVariableDriven.State<P,S>>
      Overrides:
      shouldTriggerBlockRenderUpdate in class PartTypeAdapter<P extends PartTypePanelVariableDriven<P,S>,S extends PartTypePanelVariableDriven.State<P,S>>
      Parameters:
      oldPartState - The old part state.
      newPartState - The new part state.
      Returns:
      If it should trigger a block render update.
